response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "This bill increases the capital gains tax threshold to nine percent for individuals, estates, and trusts. [CHUNK_11] The measure also increases the alternative capital gains tax for corporations to five per cent. [CHUNK_9] This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_11]",
  "appropriations": "This measure does not contain any appropriations. [CHUNK_0] The provided text does not allocate funding for any specific purpose. [CHUNK_1] The bill is an act relating to capital gains tax. [CHUNK_0]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided text does not contain information regarding assumptions or methodology for its fiscal impact. [CHUNK_0] No cost estimation methods or data sources are referenced in the bill. [CHUNK_5] The document is a bill for an act to amend existing statutes. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "The provided bill text does not describe the anticipated operational, administrative, or budgetary impact on any government agency or department. [CHUNK_0] No details are provided regarding supervision, staffing, or resource allocation. [CHUNK_4] The text is limited to amending Section 235-51 and Section 235-71.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "This bill is expected to increase state revenue by increasing the capital gains tax. [CHUNK_11] The measure increases the tax on net capital gains for individuals, estates, and trusts to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] It also increases the alternative tax for corporations to five per cent on the excess of the net capital gain for the taxable year. [CHUNK_9]",
  "policy_impact": "This bill amends Section 235-51, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to increase the tax on net capital gains from a rate of 7.25 per cent to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] It also amends Section 235-71.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, increasing the alternative tax for corporations from four per cent to five per cent on certain capital gains. [CHUNK_9] This Act modifies existing state tax policy by altering income tax rates on capital gains. [CHUNK_11]",
  "revenue_sources": "The measure does not appropriate funds from a specific revenue source. [CHUNK_0] Instead, the act is designed to generate additional state revenue by increasing the capital gains tax. [CHUNK_11] The additional tax revenue is the primary financial component of this legislation. [CHUNK_3]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided document does not contain a multi-year fiscal outlook for the proposed tax changes. [CHUNK_0] There are no projections regarding costs or revenues over a six-year period. [CHUNK_1] The bill proposes to increase the tax on net capital gains for individuals, estates, and trusts from a rate below 7.25 per cent to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] For corporations, the bill increases the alternative tax on the excess net capital gain from four per cent to five per cent. [CHUNK_9] As the statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken and new statutory material is underscored, these changes are intended to be permanent. [CHUNK_10] The fiscal impact would begin after the Act's effective date of July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_11] No specific revenue projections are provided in the text. [CHUNK_12] The ongoing fiscal implication would be an increase in state tax revenues. [CHUNK_11] The amount of this increase is not specified. [CHUNK_1] No other fiscal implications are detailed in the bill. [CHUNK_2]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This measure will increase the state's operating revenue by increasing the tax on capital gains. [CHUNK_11] For a taxpayer with a net capital gain, the tax imposed shall not exceed a sum that includes a tax of nine per cent of the amount of taxable income in excess of a certain amount. [CHUNK_3] For corporations, the alternative tax on the excess net capital gain will increase from four to five per cent. [CHUNK_9]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided bill text does not identify any capital expenditures. [CHUNK_0] There are no provisions for investments in facilities, equipment, or technology. [CHUNK_5] The bill is focused exclusively on amending tax rate statutes. [CHUNK_1]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "As the proposed statutory changes do not have a sunset clause, the fiscal implications will continue after six years. [CHUNK_10] The increased tax rates on capital gains for individuals, estates, trusts, and corporations would remain in effect. [CHUNK_4, CHUNK_6] This would result in an ongoing increase in state revenue, as the changes are permanent amendments to the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [CHUNK_1]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_0] This analysis is based solely on the text of H.B. NO. 476. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, there are no updates to report. [CHUNK_0]"
}

{
  "overview": "This bill increases the capital gains tax threshold to nine percent for individuals, estates, and trusts. [CHUNK_11] The measure also increases the alternative capital gains tax for corporations to five per cent. [CHUNK_9] This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_11]",
  "appropriations": "This measure does not contain any appropriations. [CHUNK_0] The provided text does not allocate funding for any specific purpose. [CHUNK_1] The bill is an act relating to capital gains tax. [CHUNK_0]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided text does not contain information regarding assumptions or methodology for its fiscal impact. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_4]",
  "economic_impact": "This bill is expected to increase state revenue by increasing the capital gains tax. [CHUNK_11] The measure increases the tax on net capital gains for individuals, estates, and trusts to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] It also increases the alternative tax for corporations to five per cent on the excess of the net capital gain for the taxable year. [CHUNK_9]",
  "policy_impact": "This bill amends Section 235-51, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to increase the tax on net capital gains from a rate of 7.25 per cent to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] It also amends Section 235-71.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, increasing the alternative tax for corporations from four per cent to five per cent on certain capital gains. [CHUNK_9] This Act modifies existing state tax policy by altering income tax rates on capital gains. [CHUNK_11]",
  "revenue_sources": "The measure does not appropriate funds from a specific revenue source. [CHUNK_0] Instead, the act is designed to generate additional state revenue by increasing the capital gains tax. [CHUNK_11] The additional tax revenue is the primary financial component of this legislation. [CHUNK_3]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided document does not contain a multi-year fiscal outlook for the proposed tax changes. [CHUNK_0] There are no projections regarding costs or revenues over a six-year period. [CHUNK_1] The bill proposes to increase the tax on net capital gains for individuals, estates, and trusts from a rate below 7.25 per cent to nine per cent. [CHUNK_3] For corporations, the bill increases the alternative tax on the excess net capital gain from four per cent to five per cent. [CHUNK_9] As the statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken and new statutory material is underscored, these changes are intended to be permanent. [CHUNK_10] The fiscal impact would begin after the Act's effective date of July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_11] No specific revenue projections are provided in the text. [CHUNK_12] The ongoing fiscal implication would be an increase in state tax revenues. [CHUNK_11] The amount of this increase is not specified. [CHUNK_1] No other fiscal implications are detailed in the bill. [CHUNK_2]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This measure will increase the state's operating revenue by increasing the tax on capital gains. [CHUNK_11] For a taxpayer with a net capital gain, the tax imposed shall not exceed a sum that includes a tax of nine per cent of the amount of taxable income in excess of a certain amount. [CHUNK_3] For corporations, the alternative tax on the excess net capital gain will increase from four to five per cent. [CHUNK_9]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided bill text does not identify any capital expenditures. [CHUNK_0] There are no provisions for investments in facilities, equipment, or technology. [CHUNK_5] The bill is focused exclusively on amending tax rate statutes. [CHUNK_1]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "As the proposed statutory changes do not have a sunset clause, the fiscal implications will continue after six years. [CHUNK_10] The increased tax rates on capital gains for individuals, estates, trusts, and corporations would remain in effect. [CHUNK_4, CHUNK_6] This would result in an ongoing increase in state revenue, as the changes are permanent amendments to the Hawaii Revised Statutes. [CHUNK_1]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_0] This analysis is based solely on the text of H.B. NO. 476. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, there are no updates to report. [CHUNK_0]"

exceed the sum of: (1) The tax computed at the rates and in the same manner as if this subsection had not been enacted on the greater of: (A) The taxable income reduced by the amount of net capital gain, or (B) The amount of taxable income taxed at a

or (B) The amount of taxable income taxed at a rate below [ 7.25 ] nine per cent, plus (2) A tax of [ 7.25 ] nine per cent of the amount of taxable income in excess of the amount determined under paragraph (1). This subsection shall apply to individuals,

determined under paragraph (1). This subsection shall apply to individuals, estates, and trusts for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1986." SECTION 2 . material is underscored. SECTION 4. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Capital Gains Tax; Income Tax; Increase Description: Increases the capital gains tax threshold to nine percent. Increases the alternative capital gains tax for corporations to five percent. The summary description of
